summary:
I am passionate about using technology to solve socio-technical problems, and have a strong background in software engineering and artificial intelligence. I received my Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering from HAN University of Applied Sciences and my Master's in AI for Agriculture from Wageningen University.

As a software engineer, I have the opportunity to work on a wide range of projects and am always looking for ways to expand my skills and knowledge. In addition to my work as a software engineer, I am also pursuing a PhD in collaboration with Wageningen University, where I am researching the use of digital twins for predictive maintenance.

I am excited to connect with other professionals in the field and explore new opportunities to collaborate and make an impact.

treasury_media.title: Reference architecture for digital twin-based predictive maintenance systems
treasury_media.description:
Highlights
• Architecture design approach for designing digital-twin based predictive maintenance systems.
• Feature-driven domain analysis with a detailed feature model on digital-twin based predictive maintenance systems.
• Architecture modeling of digital-twin based predictive maintenance systems using multiple architecture views.
• Approach is evaluated using three industrial case studies.
• Important lessons learned and challenges are discussed.

education.field_of_study: Software Architecture for Artificial intelligence applications

awards.title: Data Preprocessing Winner - ASReview Hackathon for Follow the Money
awards.description:
To investigate the communication between multinational oil and gas company Shell and the Dutch government, Follow the Money (FTM) is gathering and scrutinizing many many documents. The goal of the Hackathon was to help FTM find the relevant documents sooner by using active learning instead of randomly reading all documents. In the investigation of Shell Papers, there is a call for help to the general public to search through the papers for possible ties between multinational oil and gas company Shell and the Dutch government.

The Shell Papers are gathered through different so-called Wob-applications (Wet openbaarheid van bestuur – translates to Government Information (Public Access) Act). The Dutch government is requested to share information. So far, FTM has collected 2500 documents, consisting of 17000 pages. That’s a very long read, and it is only the first batch of documents: In total, around 150.000 documents are expected! 

Data
The Shell Papers (in Dutch) consist of emails, documents, WhatsApp messages, governmental decisions, and many more types of files, which are retrieved from several different counties in the Netherlands. In a nutshell, it contains a very large proportion of all communication between Shell and Dutch governmental institutions.

Track 1: Data pre-processing
Before we can do anything with the data, there has to be some pre-processing. The raw data is quite challenging, containing much noise and little structure. Most data is raw email HTML, combined with a header. Documents are labeled on correspondence, reports, permits, governmental decisions, and particular documents.

More information can be read at https://asreview.nl/blog/asreview-hackathon-for-follow-the-money/

awards.title: Market Ready Winner - Digital Agriculture Hackathon
awards.description:
Over the next few decades, a rising global population, increasing wealth, changing consumer demand, and climate variation will put growing pressure on food systems. While global demand might be met through current agricultural practices in the short term, these strategies are unsustainable for the long term. Globally, agriculture demands a radical transformation.

Together with students from Cornell University, University of São Paulo, China Agricultural University, University of California, Davis, and Wageningen University, we aimed to tackle challenges in agriculture. Our team, PicturePerfectFruits, aimed to reduce fresh produce waste in supermarkets by dynamically predicting shelf life and providing a dynamic discount based on this shelf life.

profile_positions.description: As a PhD candidate at Sioux, I am able to directly apply the knowledge I've gained as a academic into the industry, which is a privilege. My research focuses on Digital Twin-driven Predictive Maintenance Systems, both the design and implementation. I've designed a Reference Architecture for these systems and have applied it to three domains: semiconductor (ASMPT), electricity grids (Alliander), and CNC machines (internal). As such, I've had to design three products from a Model-Based Systems Design perspective, and use data-driven methods to develop algorithms to reduce downtime of the system.
profile_positions.title: PhD Candidate - Digital Twin-based Predictive Maintenance Systems

profile_positions.description:
As a Software Engineer, I have worked on numerous projects for Sioux, LUMICKS, and Alliander. My focus has been on projects with a high level of complexity in both Software Engineering, Software Design, and Data Science. 
- I have been working on a system that creates insights in the real-time condition and temperature of Medium Voltage Electricity Grid assets within the team Grid Quality Management in the System Operations department of Alliander
- I have been a Product Owner for an internal research project on Predictive Maintenance for CNC Machines with 4 Software Engineers and one Tech Lead.
- I worked on improving a Test Automation Framework for Factory Acceptance Tests for the Operations department of LUMICKS.
- I worked on numerous Machine Learning-based prototypes for green- and brownfield customers. Domains where both computer vision, as well as predictive maintenance.
- I shared knowledge from my PhD research within the company through recurrent presentations.
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
MSc. Internship: Graded with a 9.5.
Instance Segmentation on a small dataset to monitor the crystallization process of liquid mixtures. This supports the development process of chemicals, such as medicine of fertilizer. I developed a pipeline using a Mask R-CNN and PointRend model through PyTorch and Detectron2. Gained knowledge on novel ASHA hyperparameter tuning algorithm in Ray Tune.
profile_positions.title: Machine Learning Intern

profile_positions.description:
As a project within Sioux Technologies, I am:
- Building models for Alliander to predict the remaining useful lifetime of cable joints to improve the planning of maintenance engineers and reduce outages.
- Supporting at DevOps tasks for a tool that enables engineers to monitor cable conditions.
- Creating new microservices.
profile_positions.title: Data Scientist

profile_positions.description: At LUMICKS, my task is to support the development of the test automation software, AutoFAT. I work on developing automated tests, and I am the person responsible for software reviews of the AutoFAT development team. Furthermore, I was also responsible for integrating the software into the AutoFAT framework and creating releases.
profile_positions.title: QA Engineer

profile_positions.description: As an Analyst, I'm working on research for marketing campaigns for several companies. Next to research, I'm also writing consultancy content for these companies.
profile_positions.title: Analyst

profile_positions.description:
MSc. Thesis: Towards the Automation of Systematic Literature Reviews. Graded with a 9.5. Conducted a systematic literature review and developed a deep learning-based decision support system to support the primary study selection. Gained knowledge on NLP using TensorFlow and NLTK. Found optimal hyperparameters with the Keras-tuner framework. Submitted three papers to Q1 Software Engineering Journals with three publications. 
- Automation of systematic literature reviews: A systematic literature review 
- A Multi-Channel Convolutional Neural Network approach to automate the citation screening process
- A decision support system for automating document retrieval and citation screening

profile_positions.description:
At Northwestern Polytechnical University in Xi'an, I have had an assignment that was focused on Image Processing.

Firstly, a hashing model was learned based on a large-scale image database. The images were transferred to binary codes. Secondly, an interactive system was designed for visual search. Finally, the system utilized the hashing technique to search for images and returns related results to users.

profile_positions.description: During open days at the HAN in Arnhem it is my function to introduce and inform higher general secondary education and intermediate vocational education students to my education. This includes presenting my projects for this semester. At these days, the future student is on my focus. Therefore, I need to be open and start discussions with the future students and probably their parents.
